Content Security Policy

Welcome to the post-XSS world

Case Studies Recommendations Directives

A page’s Content Security Policy is defined via a set of directives. The entire set is briefly defined below, click through each to get (lots) more detail:

Content-Security-Policy:

  default-src [Sets a default source list, which
               other directives might use as a
               fallback];

  script-src  [Whitelists trusted sources of
               script, and governs use of `eval()`
               and inline script];

  object-src  [Whitelists trusted plugin content];

  style-src   [Whitelisted CSS sources, and
               controls use of inline style];

  img-src     [Whitelists image sources];

  media-src   [Whitelists video/audio sources, and
               associated data (e.g. `track`)];

  frame-src   [Which origins can the current page
               include in a frame?];

  font-src    [Whitelisted web font sources];

  connect-src [Which endpoints can script connect
               to via XHR, WebSockets, and etc?];

  sandbox     [Applies sandboxing flags to the
               current page];

  report-uri  [Where should violation reports
               be delivered?]
